short_summary: Electronic intrusion detection and access control (IDAC) system expansion,
description: PSPC requires an expansion to its existing electronic intrusion detection and access control (IDAC) system for the GCcoworking pilot project, and preventative maintenance and support services.
duration_in_months: And purchase ongoing maintenance and support services
full_summary:
===============

### Electronic Intrusion Detection and Access Control (IDAC) System Expansion

#### Tender Reference Number
`cb-8777-81073157`

#### Amendment Number
`13`

#### Solicitation Number
`10077422`

#### Publication Date
2023-09-05

#### Tender Closing Date
2023-10-25T09:00:00

#### Amendment Date
2023-10-25

#### Expected Contract Start Date
2023-10-01

#### Expected Contract End Date
2023-09-30

#### Tender Status
* Expired

#### Procurement Category
* SRVTGD

#### Notice Type
* Request for Proposal

#### Procurement Method
* Competitive - Open bidding

#### Selection Criteria
* Variations or combinations of the above methods

### Overview

PSPC (Public Services and Procurement Canada) intends to expand its existing electronic intrusion detection and access control (IDAC) system for the GCcoworking pilot project, which includes preventative maintenance and support services. The supplier must provide and deliver all necessary materials, equipment, tools, and labor required to complete the project, in accordance with the requirements outlined in the Request for Proposal (RFP).

### Evaluation Criteria

Bids will be evaluated based on mandatory technical and financial evaluation criteria.

### Note for Suppliers

All inquiries and other communications concerning this Request for Proposal must be sent in writing only to the contracting authority. PSPC provides services in both official languages of Canada.

### Tender Documents

The attached RFP documents provide further details on the specification, delivery schedule, and evaluation methodology. Suppliers are required to submit their bids in the languages specified in the RFP documents.

### Important Notes

* Canada retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.
* Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada. [1]

Attachments:

* [RFP clauses with SOW](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/12482/10077422-rfp-clauses-with-sow.pdf)
* [RFP Amendment 1](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/12482/10077422---rfp-amd-1.pdf)
